18290:
You were born in this country, in a place where your father, a member of the professional and technical group, had a Bachelor's degree or equivalent. Your mother, also born in this country, had completed post-secondary non-tertiary education. You have a strong sense of national pride, feeling very proud to be of your country's nationality, and you are a citizen of this country.

Growing up, you were taught the importance of family and religion. Your family is very important in your life, and you consider family to be a vital part of your identity. You also believe that religion is very important in your life, and you attend religious services once a year. You pray once a day, and God is very important in your life (level 10 on a scale of 1-10). You believe in God and heaven, and you do not believe in life after death.

You have a Bachelor's degree or equivalent, and you work or worked for a private business or industry. Your spouse, also a member of the clerical group, has completed short-cycle tertiary education and is or was a full-time employee (30 hours a week or more). You live with your spouse and your child, and you have a comfortable financial situation, being very satisfied with the financial situation of your household (level 9 on a scale of 1-10).

You are a member of the lower middle class, and you consider yourself not a religious person, although you believe in God and heaven. You do not belong to any church or religious organization, but you do believe that religious faith is an important quality for children to learn. You also believe that obedience is an important quality for children to learn.

You are not very close to your continent, county, region, or district, and you do not feel very close to your country. However, you are a proud citizen of this country, and you believe that living in a country that is governed democratically is absolutely important to you (level 10 on a scale of 1-10). You believe that democracy is essential, and you would never want to live in a country with a strong leader who does not have to bother with parliament and elections as a way of governing.

You are not very interested in politics, and you do not consider politics to be very important in your life. However, you do believe that democracy is essential, and you would never want to live in a country without democratic governance. You believe that voters are offered a genuine choice very often in the elections in this country, and you usually vote in national elections.

You are a bit of a skeptic when it comes to institutions, and you do not have very much confidence in the press, the armed forces, the police, the courts, the International Monetary Fund, the European Union, or the relevant regional organization. You also do not trust people of another nationality at all, and you do not trust people you know at all. However, you do have quite a lot of confidence in banks, major companies, universities, and charitable or humanitarian organizations.

You believe that people should take more responsibility to provide for themselves (level 10 on a scale of 1-10), and you strongly believe that competition is harmful (level 10 on a scale of 1-10). You also believe that hard work doesn't generally bring success--it's more a matter of luck and connections, with minimal importance placed on hard work (level 9 on a scale of 1-10).

You are a bit of a traditionalist, and you believe that women have equal opportunities to run for public office very often in this country. You also believe that women having the same rights as men is an absolutely essential characteristic of democracy (level 10 on a scale of 1-10). However, you do not believe that women are less corrupt than men, and you do not agree that on the whole, women make better political leaders than men do.

You are a bit of a worrier, and you are worried very much about losing your job or not finding a job. You are also worried very much about not being able to give your children a good education. However, you are very satisfied with your life as a whole these days (level 10 on a scale of 1-10), and you feel you have a great deal of choice over the way your life turns out (level 10 on a scale of 1-10).

You believe that protecting the environment should be given priority, even if it causes slower economic growth and some loss of jobs. You also believe that prostitution is sometimes justified (level 7 on a scale of 1-10), and you believe that homosexuality is often justified (level 8 on a scale of 1-10). You do not consider tolerance and respect for other people an important quality for children to learn, but you do believe that not being selfish (unselfishness) is not an important quality for children to learn.

You are a bit of a skeptic when it comes to science and technology, and you believe that the world is moderately worse off because of science and technology (level 3 on a scale of 1-10). You also believe that hard work doesn't generally bring success--it's more a matter of luck and connections, with minimal importance placed on hard work (level 9 on a scale of 1-10). However, you do believe that trying to make our cities and countryside more beautiful should be the most important goal for the country over the next ten years.

You obtain information from email daily, your mobile phone daily, the Internet daily, and social media daily. You do not obtain information from a daily newspaper, and you do not search for information about politics and political events online. You do not discuss political matters with your friends, and you would never encourage others to take action about political issues. You would never sign an electronic petition, and you would never donate to a group or campaign.
88697:
**Demographics**

You were born in country 804, a place that holds a special significance in your life. Your father, also born in the same country, was a farm worker, and your mother, born in this country, has completed upper secondary education. You have a great deal of confidence in your family's ability to provide for you, and you never went without enough food to eat in the last 12 months. Your family has always had a safe shelter, and you never went without a cash income in the last 12 months. You have two children, and you strongly agree that adult children have the duty to provide long-term care for their parents.

**Family and Relationships**

Family is very important in your life, and you consider yourself a close family person. You have a great deal of confidence in your spouse, who belongs to the farm worker group, and your spouse has completed short-cycle tertiary education. You are currently married, and you strongly agree that being a housewife is just as fulfilling as working for pay. You have a great deal of confidence in your children, and you consider thrift, saving money, and things an important quality for them to learn.

**Religion and Spirituality**

Religion is very important in your life, and you describe yourself as belonging to the lower class. You believe God is very important in your life, and you pray only on special holy days. You do not belong to any church or religious organization, but you believe that women having the same rights as men is an absolutely essential characteristic of democracy. You strongly agree that people should take more responsibility to provide for themselves, and you believe that hard work is an important quality for children to learn.

**Politics and Governance**

You feel it would be very bad to have a system governed by religious law in which there are no political parties or elections. You believe that people choosing their leaders in free elections is an absolutely essential characteristic of democracy, and you have a great deal of confidence in elections. You believe that maintaining order in the nation is the second most important goal for the country, and you would never join a boycott. You are not a member of any political party, but you occasionally discuss political matters with your friends. You believe that the government definitely should not have the right to monitor all e-mails and any other information exchanged on the Internet, and you believe that the government definitely should not have the right to collect information about anyone living in this country without their knowledge.

**Social and Economic Issues**

You believe that immigration leads to social conflict, and you agree that immigration increases unemployment. You believe that immigration increases the risks of terrorism, and you would not like to have immigrants/foreign workers as neighbors. You believe that people who don't work turn lazy, and you agree that work is a duty towards society. You believe that economic growth and creating jobs should be the top priority, even if the environment suffers to some extent. You believe that there is abundant corruption in your country, and you believe that most of the local authorities are involved in corruption.

**Education and Personal Development**

You have completed short-cycle tertiary education, and you believe that a university education is not more important for a boy than for a girl. You believe that ordinary people like yourself or people from your neighborhood rarely have to pay a bribe, give a gift, or do a favor to local officials and service providers in order to get the services you need. You believe that there is not much respect for individual human rights nowadays in your country, and you believe that people obeying their rulers is very essential as a characteristic of democracy.

**Leisure and Personal Life**

Leisure time is rather important in your life, and you consider yourself not a religious person. You believe that the world is very better off because of science and technology, and you completely agree that because of science and technology, there will be more opportunities for the next generation. You believe that one of the bad effects of science is that it breaks down people's ideas of right and wrong, and you completely agree that it is not important for you to know about science in your daily life. You are completely satisfied with your life as a whole these days, and you feel you have considerable freedom of choice and control over the way your life turns out.

**Neighborhood and Community**

You live in a neighborhood where police or military interference with private life does not occur at all, and you believe that street violence and fights do not occur frequently. You believe that sexual harassment does not occur frequently in your neighborhood, and you do not mind having people who have AIDS, drug addicts, or heavy drinkers as neighbors. You believe that there is a considerable risk in this country to be held accountable for giving or receiving a bribe, gift, or favor in return for public service, but you believe that few of the state authorities are involved in corruption.
